channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump says he doesn't want Somalis in the U.S., urges them to go back to their homeland and fix it
item.description: President Trump says he doesn't want Somali immigrants in the U.S., saying residents of the war-ravaged eastern African country are too reliant on U.S. social safety net and add little to the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he doesn't want Somali immigrants in the U.S., saying residents of the war-ravaged eastern African country are too reliant on U.S. social safety net and add little to the U.S.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A bitter dispute between China and Japan has moved to the cultural front
item.description: A bitter dispute between East Asia's biggest powers, China and Japan, has moved to the cultural front. With both sides unwilling to back down, experts say it could be a protracted feud.
item.content:encoded: A bitter dispute between East Asia's biggest powers, China and Japan, has moved to the cultural front. With both sides unwilling to back down, experts say it could be a protracted feud.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: What we know about Russia-Ukraine peace talks at the Kremlin
item.description: U.S. envoys Jared Kushner and Steve Witkoff visit Moscow to present the Ukraine peace proposal.
item.content:encoded: U.S. envoys Jared Kushner and Steve Witkoff visit Moscow to present the Ukraine peace proposal.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: Pope Leo wraps up his visit to Lebanon with prayers at the site of Beirut's port blast
item.description: Pope Leo XIV ended his first overseas papal trip with prayers at Beirut's devastated port and a Mass attended by 150,000 worshippers in a country desperate for signs of hope amid fear of renewed war.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Leo XIV ended his first overseas papal trip with prayers at Beirut's devastated port and a Mass attended by 150,000 worshippers in a country desperate for signs of hope amid fear of renewed war.

(Image credit: Adri Salido)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: National Guard attack suspect's crisis. And, U.S. official sheds light on boat strike
item.description: A U.S. official disputes the White House account of the deadly Caribbean boat strike. And, a person familiar with the National Guard shooting suspect says he was suffering a personal crisis.
item.content:encoded:
A U.S. official disputes the White House account of the deadly Caribbean boat strike. And, a person familiar with the National Guard shooting suspect says he was suffering a personal crisis.

(Image credit: Felix Leon)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Former NATO ambassador on whether Russia might consider the latest Ukraine peace deal
item.description: Will Russia accept a modified proposal to end the war in Ukraine? NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with former NATO Ambassador Kurt Volker.
item.content:encoded: Will Russia accept a modified proposal to end the war in Ukraine? NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with former NATO Ambassador Kurt Volker.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: U.S. envoy back in Moscow as peace talks to end war continue
item.description: U.S. envoy Steve Witkoff is in Moscow to present the latest version of the Ukraine peace plan to Russian President Vladimir Putin Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: U.S. envoy Steve Witkoff is in Moscow to present the latest version of the Ukraine peace plan to Russian President Vladimir Putin Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: El Chapo's son details abduction of a Sinaloa boss in his guilty plea deal
item.description: Joaquín Guzmán López, the 39-year-old son of former Sinaloa cartel kingpin Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán, pleaded guilty to two counts of drug trafficking and continuing criminal enterprise in U.S. court.
item.content:encoded:
Joaquín Guzmán López, the 39-year-old son of former Sinaloa cartel kingpin Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán, pleaded guilty to two counts of drug trafficking and continuing criminal enterprise in U.S. court.

(Image credit: US Department of State)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Afghans seeking asylum say the dream of reaching the U.S. seems ever further away
item.description: Afghans who were in the process of seeking asylum in the United States have had their hopes repeatedly dashed under this Trump administration. In the U.S., they live in fear of ICE detention.
item.content:encoded: Afghans who were in the process of seeking asylum in the United States have had their hopes repeatedly dashed under this Trump administration. In the U.S., they live in fear of ICE detention.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Afghan suspect in D.C. National Guard attack appeared to suffer personal crisis
item.description: Rahmanullah Lakanwal, an Afghan national, is accused of shooting two National Guard soldiers on Nov. 26. One of those soldiers, 20-year-old Sarah Beckstrom, died from her wounds.
item.content:encoded:
Rahmanullah Lakanwal, an Afghan national, is accused of shooting two National Guard soldiers on Nov. 26. One of those soldiers, 20-year-old Sarah Beckstrom, died from her wounds.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann
